qas.question: What kind of protocol is the Robots Exclusion Standard?
What file is utilized to exercise the rights promoted by the Robots Exclusion Standard?
If a site prevents Internet Archive from recording it, what file is still saved?
What kind of protocol is the Internet Archive?
What file is utilized to exercise the rights promoted by the Internet Archive?
If a site prevents Internet Archive from recording it, what file is rendered unavailable?
What does the Healthcare Advocates respect?

context: <a1_0><a2_0>Robots.txt<a2_0/><a1_0/> is used as part of the <b6_0>Robots Exclusion Standard<b6_0/>, a <a0_0><b3_0>voluntary<b3_0/><a0_0/> protocol the Internet Archive respects that disallows bots from indexing certain pages delineated by its creator as off-limits. As a result, the Internet Archive has rendered unavailable a number of web sites that now are inaccessible through the Wayback Machine. Currently, the Internet Archive applies <b4_0><b5_0>robots.txt<b5_0/><b4_0/> rules retroactively; if a site blocks the Internet Archive, such as Healthcare Advocates, any previously archived pages from the domain are rendered unavailable as well. In cases of blocked sites, only the robots.txt file is archived.
